primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from a state of terminal spiritual sickness (sin) to a state of wholeness through the arrival and sacrifice of a 'foreign' healer (Christ).

tekstueel_bewijs: Christ came here from a great distance
heals all our disease and takes away the awful sickness of sin
the health of the daughter of my people recovered
In the fullness of time... God sent his Son
save his people from their sins
healing for all of our spiritual sickness
his broken body... has opened the way
with his stripes we are healed
helper.rol_van_geest: External help (Implicitly the means of grace)

tekstueel_bewijs: destroys the nervous system of conscience
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as a 'fatal malady' that no earthly power (education, wealth, culture) can cure.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human attempt to find earthly cures for the soul's sickness.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: Humanity / Israel
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is presented as a failed attempt (Savoir-faire without Pouvoir-faire) that necessitates the Primary Program.

voorbeelden_god_subject: Christ came here from a great distance
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We keep looking for pretty, attractive healers

voorbeelden: generations sighed for some such cure
when we know what is right, we will do what is right (cited as false knowledge)
beyond the power of the ancient doctors
no human cure which will get to the seat of the disease
the one who could and does heal us

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the total lack of human 'Pouvoir' (ability) and the external endowment of 'Pouvoir' through Christ.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Sin's symptoms) to ~S1 (False cures) to S1 (The Balm/Christ).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'importation' of the Balm from outside the system (Gilead/Heaven).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; sin is treated as an ontological and fatal reality.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It explicitly rejects human agency (education, wealth, politics) as a means of salvation and positions Christ as the sole active Subject who must be 'bruised' to provide the 'Pouvoir' for healing.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God sent his Son... Christ heals all.
fatal disease — sin — which destroys the nervous system of conscience

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jeremiah is used as a 'witness' to the pain, not as a moral example to be emulated for salvation.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: Jeremiah's grief reflects God's heart for the sick.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and surrender; moving from self-effort to receiving the 'Balm'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic healing; salvation is entirely of God.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The metaphor of the Balm is perfectly integrated with the actantial roles of Christ and the condition of the hearer.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: bruised for our iniquities, wounded for our transgressions

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'healing fluid' acts as the endowment of power.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Terminal; sin is a 'fatal malady' beyond human reach.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon maintains a consistent structure where Christ is the Subject and the hearer is the Receiver.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Strong emphasis on Pouvoir (Ability) of Christ.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The sermon successfully avoids the Devoir (Must) trap.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in grace-oriented preaching that uses a biblical metaphor to strip the hearer of self-reliance.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the 'Balm' metaphor's beauty, Greimas reveals the 'Balm' as the essential Helper/Object that shifts the Subject from Man to God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the historical Gilead; semiotics focuses on the functional necessity of an 'external' actant to solve the 'internal' lack.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: The analysis proves that the sermon's power comes from its 'Subject-Switch'—the hearer is never asked to heal themselves, only to receive the Healer.

appendices.notities: The sermon avoids 'Exemplarism' by treating Jeremiah as a witness to the problem rather than the solution.
